etymologies: mid 19th century; earliest use found in American National Preacher. From ancient Greek ἐπιστήμη knowledge, understanding, skill, scientific knowledge from ἐπιστάναι to know, understand (probably from ἐπι- + ἱστάναι to stand) + -μη, suffix forming nouns; the -η- of the second syllable of ἐπιστήμη is probably after nouns such as μνήμη memory, ϕήμη words, speech

definitions: Scientific knowledge, a system of understanding; specifically (Foucault's term for) the body of ideas which shape the perception of knowledge in a particular period.
